summary: This is an email chain from February 17, 2021, between Assistant United States Attorneys in the Southern District of New York (SDNY) discussing the Ghislaine Maxwell case. The prosecutors are seeking to identify a person named 'i'MMa' who is referenced in a file from the Southern District of Florida (SD Fla) and whom the defense suggests worked at SDNY. The chain also mentions a deceased former AUSA who worked with a former Chief of Public Corruption.

persons.name: i'MMa
persons.role: Person of interest referenced in a case file
persons.context: Mentioned as a name referenced in a file from the Southern District of Florida; the defense in the Ghislaine Maxwell case is suggesting this person worked at the Southern District of New York (SDNY).

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the case being briefed by the prosecutors; her defense team is making a suggestion about the person 'i'MMa'.

connections.description: i'MMa is referenced in a case file related to the Ghislaine Maxwell prosecution, with the defense suggesting i'MMa worked at SDNY.

events.title: Prosecutors research person 'i'MMa' in Maxwell case
events.description: Assistant United States Attorneys in SDNY exchange emails to identify a person named 'i'MMa' referenced in an SD Fla file, as the defense in the Ghislaine Maxwell case suggests this person worked at SDNY.

keyFacts: Prosecutors in the Ghislaine Maxwell case are trying to identify a person named 'i'MMa' who is referenced in a file from the Southern District of Florida.
The defense in the Maxwell case has suggested that 'i'MMa' worked at the Southern District of New York (SDNY).
The email chain reveals internal prosecution coordination and fact-checking regarding a potential witness or figure connected to the case.
A deceased former Assistant United States Attorney (AUSA) is mentioned as having worked with a former Chief of Public Corruption, but she had no connection to SD Fla.
